title: Assistant Professor, Tenure Track Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Unfortunately, it appears that they had already selected the candidate they wished to hire and went through the entire process without any intention of considering me as a potential hire. This has resulted in a waste of my time and energy.
Interview Questions: Did not ask any question during the campus interview

title: Nursing Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Panel Interview Tell me about yourself? Why do you want to be a nurse? Why Adelphi? What are your strengths? What are your weaknesses? How do you manage time? What is mistake you made and what have you learned from it?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Sent them my resume. Emailed back and forth for a couple of days and then they emailed me a time and day to come in for the interview. The interview lasted about a hour and it was in front of 3 people.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience in the field

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Highly motivated, and independent were key requirements for the opportunity.    Coordination of applications and interviews for the graduation program.  Full circle of work seeing the student start and in most cases complete the program with their masters.
Interview Questions: Multitasking and connecting with the students

title: Student Services Graduate Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The employer will ask many questions about your experience of customer service and office work, then she will let you know how busy is this job. The employer will try to know your attitude and how will you go through the work with time management and calm. The whole process is comfortable.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me the customer service experience on your resume?

title: Assistant Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted with very friendly staff and faculty. The questions were right on point and stayed true to your unique, past experiences (a refreshing experience from the generic interview process).
Interview Questions: Describe how you embrace diversity and inclusion in the classroom.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with behavioral and technical questions by 3 people. I submitted my application and resume online and received a call to come in for an in-person interview the following week.
Interview Questions: What is your weakness and how does it reflect in your work?

title: Event Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job and a few days later I was scheduled for an interview. It was a committee of three; individuals I would be working with if I was hired. During the interview, as I described my current work experience, one individual demeaned my title of Coordinator to a "scheduler", and didn't give me the opportunity to explain that that is not what I do. The same individual also said "you have a lot of education but it doesn't seem like you put it to good use". I was also told by another individual "since your work experience is not extensive...do you have management experience?". I found all of these statements to be insulting. If my 7 years of relevant work experience wasn't extensive and I didn't put my education to use, then why was I called in for an interview in the first place? The people conducting the interview acted like they had somewhere else to be, as if the interview process was a burden for them. At the end of the interview I was told that I would hear from them three weeks following the interview if I were to be selected for a second interview. Two weeks after the interview I was called and told that the position was filled...
Interview Questions: They asked me to introduce myself

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Adelphi University in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Typical academic interview process. Submit requested docs and recommendation letters.  Phone interview shortly after. In my case there was a long break in between the phone interview and the in person interview.
Interview Questions: How would you teach to a diverse population of students?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was better than everyone that interviewed me. I was obviously over qualified. They were disorganized and lazy. Anyone could work there. Bad feeling about the administration. The parking is terrible. train to slow, street too long
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard phone screen, followed by in person interview. Very odd combination of corporate environment and academia , but make no mistake they see this as a business disguised as a university and the students are customers you are expected to satisfy.
Interview Questions: Why Adelphi?

title: Accommodation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Adelphi University (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They ask results-driven questions. Show interest in your background and why you care about the position.  They also give you an opportunity to ask them questions, discuss schedule, etc. Overall, the interview process is not stressful, while it's quite formal it is led in a friendly atmosphere.
Interview Questions: As a business major, why are you interested in this position, what can you bring to the table

title: ERM Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was good. The hiring manager was polite and professional. The interview envorinment was private. I was promised a result in a month. However,I never hear back.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to carry out ERM

title: Event Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied on paper at a job fair and was recommended by a friend at the table. They called me within the week. I went into a room with 2 supervisors and one of them talked for the most part. They explained the job and the responsibilities.  The interview lasted around 15-20 mins and then I received a call later on in the week with a job offer.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the team?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Reviewed resume, I walked them through it, answered questions regarding previous experience. My background (business and marketing) did not really match the job (Accommodations Specialist) but they thought that I'd be a good fit in bringing a new perspective and fresh ideas to the office. Everyone was very nice. They explained me my responsibilities very clearly.
Interview Questions: Are you ok with commuting from Manhattan to Garden City?

title: Assistant Project Director - Grant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I brought in my resume and I talked with her one-on-one for less than 5 minutes. I knew the previous C-step tutor and he recommended me for the position so he provided most of my information already. The interview was more of a formality
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Everything was done online, they contacted you if they wanted to interview you. The only way to check the status of your application was to go online and see if the status read "successfully submitted, under review, rejected"
Interview Questions: Long term goal?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview shortly after submitting my application. I met with three senior members of the department for about 15 - 20 minutes each. I was offered the job a few days later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle difficult situations that may arise during your work day?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Easy, very comfortable and informative.
I was asked about my experience in graduate school, what I was looking to learn and how many hours could I commit to the the internship.
Interview Questions: Where did I work?

title: Residence Hall Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: The preliminary screening was about an hour long with the director. It was pretty laid back, and the director seemed nice. Unfortunately they're looking for older candidates, which in my opinion seemed a bit "ageist". Overall the interview process was quick, and moved quickly, but upon arriving it was a bit confusing. I was never told where to go, or how to get into the building. The administrative staff seemed very sweet and helpful.
Interview Questions:
"Do you think you would be able to be assertive?" 
"How do you think you would deal with a difficult student/student staff member?"
"What managerial experience do you have that you could relate to the position?"
"Do you think you'd have any issue with being homesick?" 
"How are your public speaking skills?"

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job online and received a call requesting an interview within a few days. The interview process was very brief, 5 to 10 minutes total. The interviewer telling me a lot about the school without really asking much about myself. The man was very friendly, but I walked away with a hesitant feeling towards the position.
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this position?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Adelphi University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed off-site for first interview with chief promotion officer and marketing associate. A test was provided for basic industry specific computer skills at the first interview; Called back for 2nd interview on-site with creative director and marketing associate.
Interview Questions: Questions were straight forward.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I was hired immediately to cover for another professor who was ill during
the semester. There was a brief interview over the telephone (the interviewer
already had my curriculum vitae), and then I came to the office and was
hired.
Interview Questions: Was I available immediately?

title: Student Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview was easy. Questions were cookie cutter. It was a one on one interview then I had a second interview with the Director of the department. Very Easy and It took and very short while. Only about an hour or two each interview
Interview Questions: Describe for me a time in your life when you struggled and how did you overcome it?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straightforward with one operations managers and the student managers also being involved. Questions were fair and the managers asked basic questions about experience, customer service, etc. I felt that they were looking for hard workers who were available and trust worthy to accomodate a busy University Center.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule and availability like on weekends?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University (New York, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: A Phone interview which basically talked about my prior work experience and going over my cover letter, followed by an in person interview with multiple professors and a data project using a software
Interview Questions: What is your experience with data?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I had a group interview.  The experience was nothing out of the ordinary, aside from the fact that I had only been interviewed by one person up till this point. The questions asked were not trying to stump you, they really just wanted to see how you responded to job related questions like "how would you advise a student that is uncertain of his career path?"
Interview Questions: There wasn't any questions that threw me off guard, it was your basic textbook interview

title: Accounting Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: some questions to convince the interview that you are eager to learn and dedicated to your works. Simply introduced you background and what you can brought and help to the team. Be sure to mention you are well organized person and hard worker.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Media Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Adelphi University (Garden City, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Ann Terry came up to me after a class I had one day and she asked me what my schedule was like for the semester. She then proceeded to tell me that she was hiring students to fill a position as a Technician in the Media Lab (or Mac Lab, according to students and faculty). She detailed the criteria for the position and stated that training from the Department was also given. It was not in any way a formal sit down interview but she stated that she was confident in my ability and skills required for the position and said that because of my relation and length of time within the Department was also a plus.
Interview Questions: What types of programs do you have a knowledge of? Your experience using those programs?
